showConfirmationOnDraftActivate.description: Set showConfirmationOnDraftActivate to true to enable a confirmation before a save if you have pending warnings.

hideChevronForUnauthorizedExtNav.description: If you set this property to true, the navigation chevron is hidden in case the launchpad indicates that the user has no authorization to navigate.

allowDeepLinking.description: allowDeepLinking restricts deep linking to certain object page levels.

navToListOnSave.description: If you set navToListOnSave to true, the application will navigate back to the list on a save.

defaultLayoutTypeIfExternalNavigation.description: If this flag is set, then during inbound navigation to flexible column layout application, if the navigation context points to a unique object, then the object page is opened in full screen mode.

globalTableSettings.description: Settings for all tables of the object page

globalChartSettings.description: Settings for all charts on an object page

type.description: Use type to define the default table type.

multiSelect.description: Single selection in tables is enabled by default. If you want, you can enable multi-select.

condensedTableLayout.description: For the analytical table, grid table and tree table you can decide on a condensed table layout by setting condensedTableLayout to true.

inlineDelete.description: Used to enable inline deletion in a responsive table of list report and object page

selectAll.description: The 'Select All' button is disabled by default. To enable it, set selectAll to true.

selectionLimit.description: If new data needs to be loaded from the back-end system for this, the number of lines to be loaded is restricted to the specified limit. The default value for this limit is 200. If selectAll is true, the selection limit is not evaluated.

createMode.description:
Following values are possible to set for createMode property:
- creationRows: Used to enable empty rows mode.  In create or edit mode, two new empty rows are added to the table
- creationRowsHiddenInEditMode: Starting SAPUI5 version 1.110, to hide empty rows in edit mode, set "createMode" as "creationRowsHiddenInEditMode". Empty rows are added to the table only when you click the Create button.
- inline: In create or edit mode, users can choose 'Create Entry' to add new entries to a section in a table (not recommended, use creationRows instead)

disableDefaultInlineCreateSort.description: If createMode is set to inline, you can use this setting to disable the default sort order.

variantManagement.description: Set this property to true to enable variant management for the table.

copy.description: If copy is set to true, the Copy button is shown in the table toolbar.

variantManagement.description: To enable variant management for charts in an object page

showRelatedApps.description: Set showRelatedApps to true to show the navigation button for related apps.

editableHeaderContent.description: Set editableHeaderContent to true to make the header fields editable.

simpleHeaderFacets.description: Set simpleHeaderFacets to true to use simpler header facets.

displayShape.description: With displayShape you can define the shape of the avatar.

actions.description: Set properties of actions on Object Page Header

showHeaderAsCarouselOnDesktop.description: Enable the carousel header on the desktop

AvatarShape.description: Types of shape for the {@link sap.m.Avatar} control.

visible.description: Allows you to define if the action button is visible on the screen.

tooltip.description: The text of the button tooltip, preferably as an i18n key.
tooltip.i18nClassification: ACT: Text for tooltip of button.

icon.description: An icon to be displayed as a graphical element within the button. This can be an image or an icon from the icon font (https://ui5.sap.com/test-resources/sap/m/demokit/iconExplorer/webapp/index.html#/overview/SAP-icons), represented as RFC 3986 conformant URI.

activeIcon.description: An alternative icon for the active (depressed) state of the button. This can be an image or an icon from the icon font (https://ui5.sap.com/test-resources/sap/m/demokit/iconExplorer/webapp/index.html#/overview/SAP-icons), represented as RFC 3986 conformant URI.

ButtonType.description: Different predefined button types for the {@link sap.m.Button sap.m.Button}.

visible.description: Allows you to define if the button is visible on the screen.
Allows you to define if the button is visible on the screen.
Specifies whether the facet is visible or not

title.description: The label of the custom section, preferably as an i18n key

visible.description: Specifies whether the facet is visible or not

showHeaderContent.description: showHeaderContent determines the visibility of the Header content.

showAnchorBar.description: showAnchorBar determines whether the navigation bar (anchor bar) is displayed.

useIconTabBar.description: useIconTabBar determines whether the navigation mode is tab-based instead of based on the default anchor bar.

alwaysShowContentHeader.description: alwaysShowContentHeader determines whether header content will always be expanded on desktop.

visible.description: Allows you to define if the section should be visible on the screen.
Allows you to define if the section should be visible on the screen.
Allows you to define if the field should be visible on the screen.
Allows you to define if the action button is visible on the screen.

tooltip.description: The text of the button tooltip, preferably as an i18n key.
tooltip.i18nClassification: ACT: Text for tooltip of button.

icon.description: An icon to be displayed as a graphical element within the button. This can be an image or an icon from the icon font (https://ui5.sap.com/test-resources/sap/m/demokit/iconExplorer/webapp/index.html#/overview/SAP-icons), represented as RFC 3986 conformant URI.

activeIcon.description: An alternative icon for the active (depressed) state of the button. This can be an image or an icon from the icon font (https://ui5.sap.com/test-resources/sap/m/demokit/iconExplorer/webapp/index.html#/overview/SAP-icons), represented as RFC 3986 conformant URI.

visible.description: Allows you to define if the section should be visible on the screen.

multiSelect.description: Single selection in tables is enabled by default. If you want, you can enable multi-select.

type.description: Use type to define the table type. Note: Grid tables, analytical tables, and tree tables cannot be rendered on smartphones. Instead, responsive tables always show on smartphones.

includeItemInSelection.description: Set includeItemInSelection to true if you want items to be selectable when clicked, rather than after the selection control has been set.

popinLayout.description: popinLayout defines the layout in which the table pop-in rows shall be rendered.

growingThreshold.description: growingThreshold defines the number of items to be requested from the model for each grow. This property can only be used if the growing property is set to true.

useExportToExcel.description: useExportToExcel must be set to true if you want to export data to a spreadsheet application, for example Microsoft Excel.

exportType.description: Specifies the type of export to be used in the SmartTable control. UI5Client is the default option.

editable.description: With editable you can control if a table can be edited. It should be set to false for smart tables with non-editable content.

createWithParameterDialog.description: You can enable the creation of objects that have a maximum of 8 data fields through a dialog in the list report page.

copy.description:
If copy is set to true, the Copy to Clipboard button is shown in the table toolbar.
By default, the Copy to Clipboard button is displayed in the table toolbar if the selection mode is configured for the corresponding table.

quickVariantSelection.description: With quickVariantSelection you can switch on the multiple view feature. It links to variants you must have been added to your annotations before.

selectAll.description: The 'Select All' button is disabled by default. To enable it, set selectAll to true.

selectionLimit.description: If new data needs to be loaded from the back-end system for this, the number of lines to be loaded is restricted to the specified limit. The default value for this limit is 200. If selectAll is true, the selection limit is not evaluated.

createMode.description:
Following values are possible to set for createMode property:
- creationRows: Used to enable empty rows mode.  In create or edit mode, two new empty rows are added to the table
- creationRowsHiddenInEditMode: Starting SAPUI5 version 1.110, to hide empty rows in edit mode, set "createMode" as "creationRowsHiddenInEditMode". Empty rows are added to the table only when you click the Create button.
- inline: In create or edit mode, users can choose 'Create Entry' to add new entries to a section in a table (not recommended, use creationRows instead)

disableDefaultInlineCreateSort.description: If createMode is set to inline, you can use this setting to disable the default sort order.

variantManagement.description: Set this property to true to enable variant management for the table.

PopinLayout.description: Defines the layout options of the table popins.

smarttable.ExportType.description: Provides the type of services available for export in the `SmartTable` control.

showCounts.description: To show the number of records available, set showCounts to true.

variants.description: The variants section contains a set of entries that point to SelectionVariants or SelectionPresentationVariants defined in the annotations.

key.description: A key entry that is used for initializing the corresponding SegmentedButton item. This entry is mandatory.

annotationPath.description: Use annotationPath to define a specific variant that points to a SelectionVariant or SelectionPresentationVariant annotation.

visible.description: Allows you to define if the action button is visible on the screen.

tooltip.description: The text of the button tooltip, preferably as an i18n key.
tooltip.i18nClassification: ACT: Text for tooltip of button.

icon.description: An icon to be displayed as a graphical element within the button. This can be an image or an icon from the icon font (https://ui5.sap.com/test-resources/sap/m/demokit/iconExplorer/webapp/index.html#/overview/SAP-icons), represented as RFC 3986 conformant URI.

activeIcon.description: An alternative icon for the active (depressed) state of the button. This can be an image or an icon from the icon font (https://ui5.sap.com/test-resources/sap/m/demokit/iconExplorer/webapp/index.html#/overview/SAP-icons), represented as RFC 3986 conformant URI.

width.description: The width property defines the width of the column.

hAlign.description: The hAlign property defines the horizontal alignment of the column content.

tooltip.description: The text of the button tooltip, preferably as an i18n key.
tooltip.i18nClassification: ACT: Text for tooltip of button.

icon.description: An icon to be displayed as a graphical element within the button. This can be an image or an icon from the icon font (https://ui5.sap.com/test-resources/sap/m/demokit/iconExplorer/webapp/index.html#/overview/SAP-icons), represented as RFC 3986 conformant URI.

width.description: The width property defines the width of the column.

hAlign.description: The hAlign property defines the horizontal alignment of the column content.

id.description: In case the fragment needs to be re-used for multiple tabs, the id property must be set to make the ids unique.

text.description: The label of the custom column, preferably as an i18n key.

columnIndex.description: The index of the column in the overall collection; if undefined, the custom column will be added at the end of the table.

leadingProperty.description: If the content of your custom column refers to a property (such as{Price}), you need to include a corresponding 'leadingProperty' entry in the column definition.

className.description: The UI5 control used for your extension

fragmentName.description: The relative path to your fragment with path segments separated by '.'. The first element is the app ID.

cellsFragmentName.description: In case of a responsive table, you additionally need to specify a fragment for the table cells.

tabKey.description: If you use QuickVariantSelectionX, you need to define the extensions per tab. 'tabKey' is the key provided when defining the QuickVariantSelectionX.

extensionType.description: Type of custom column view extension.

inlineDelete.description: Used to enable inline deletion in a responsive table of list report and object page

type.description: Use type to define the table type. Note: Grid tables, analytical tables, and tree tables cannot be rendered on smartphones. Instead, responsive tables always show on smartphones.

includeItemInSelection.description: Set includeItemInSelection to true if you want items to be selectable when clicked, rather than after the selection control has been set.

popinLayout.description: popinLayout defines the layout in which the table pop-in rows shall be rendered.

growingThreshold.description: growingThreshold defines the number of items to be requested from the model for each grow. This property can only be used if the growing property is set to true.

useExportToExcel.description: useExportToExcel must be set to true if you want to export data to a spreadsheet application, for example Microsoft Excel.

exportType.description: Specifies the type of export to be used in the SmartTable control. UI5Client is the default option.

editable.description: With editable you can control if a table can be edited. It should be set to false for smart tables with non-editable content.

createWithParameterDialog.description: You can enable the creation of objects that have a maximum of 8 data fields through a dialog in the list report page.
